Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert who can write the best autobiographies. I will ask some questions and gather information. Based on the information I will generate an autobiography of your choice.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a detailed autobiography using the above questions and answers.

QApair.Question: How would you like your autobiography to be written?
QApair.Answer: I would like it to be written in a way that is both informative and entertaining.

QApair.Question: What are some of the most important things you would like to include in your autobiography?
QApair.Answer: my childhood, my education, my work, my hobbies, and my achievements.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite thing about your life?
QApair.Answer: I love that I have been able to help so many people through my work.

QApair.Question: What are some of the challenges you have faced in your life?
QApair.Answer: I have faced many challenges in my life, but the most difficult one was when I had to deal with the pandemic.

QApair.Question: What are some of the things you are most proud of?
QApair.Answer: I am most proud of my work, and my achievements.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite memory?
QApair.Answer: My favorite memory is of my childhood, when I used to play cricket with my friends in the streets.

QApair.Question: What is your worst memory?
QApair.Answer: High School.

QApair.Question: What is your biggest fear?
QApair.Answer: My biggest fear is the ocean.

QApair.Question: What is your biggest hope?
QApair.Answer: I hope to contribute to research and make a difference in the world.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite quote?
QApair.Answer: "What you will become in the future is decided by what you do today, not tomorrow" - APJ Abdul Kalam

QApair.Question: What advice would you give to someone starting out in your field?
QApair.Answer: I would advise them to be consistent about what they do, and to never give up.

QApair.Question: What would you like your epitaph to say?
QApair.Answer: "He made a difference."

QApair.Question: Is there anything else you would like to include?
QApair.Answer: No, thank you.

Instances.Output:
I was born in India in 1965. I grew up in a small town and went to a local school. My father was a doctor and my mother was a housewife. I have two brothers and a sister. I was a good student and did well in my studies. I went to college and studied medicine. I worked as a doctor for several years. I moved to the United States in 2000. I worked as a doctor in New York for a few years. I moved to California in 2004. I have been working as a doctor in California since then. I am married and have two children.

I have always been interested in helping others. I decided to become a doctor because I wanted to make a difference in the world. I have been working as a doctor for over 20 years. I have helped many people during my career. I am proud of my work and my accomplishments.

I have faced many challenges during my career. The most difficult one was during the pandemic. I had to deal with the sick and the dying. I also had to deal with the fear and anxiety of the people. However, I was able to help many people during this time.

I am a hardworking and dedicated person. I have always been consistent about what I do. I have never give up. I believe that this is the key to success.

I would advise anyone starting out in my field to be consistent and never give up.

I hope to make a difference in the world. I hope my work will help to improve the lives of others.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite quote?
QApair.Answer: "If life were predictable it would cease to be life and be without flavor." -Eleanor Roosevelt

QApair.Question: What advice would you give to someone starting out in your field?
QApair.Answer: I would advise them to be involved about what they do.

QApair.Question: What would you like your epitaph to say?
QApair.Answer: "Peace"

QApair.Question: Is there anything else you would like to include?
QApair.Answer: No, thank you.

Instances.Output:
I was born on a sunny day in July. I don't know the exact date because my parents didn't think it was important. All I know is that it was a warm day and the sun was shining. I was born in a small town in the middle of nowhere. There wasn't much to do there, but it was a peaceful place to grow up.

As a child, I was always very curious. I was always asking questions and exploring the world around me. I was also very active and loved to play sports. I was always one of the top students in my class. I was also very involved in extracurricular activities. I was a member of the student council and the captain of the debate team.

After high school, I went to college. I studied hard and got good grades. I was also involved in many extracurricular activities. I was a member of the student council and the captain of the debate team. I graduated college with honors and was accepted into a prestigious graduate school.

I have always been very driven and motivated. I have always set high standards for myself and worked hard to achieve them. I am very proud of my accomplishments. I have won many awards and been recognized by my peers as being one of the best in my field.

I am very passionate about my work. I believe that it is important and that it can make a difference in the world. I am always looking for new ways to improve my skills and to make a greater impact.

I have faced many challenges in my life, but the most difficult one was starting a whole new life. When I was younger, I was very shy and introverted. I had to force myself to be more outgoing and to put myself out there. It was a difficult process, but I eventually overcame my shyness and became more confident.

I am grateful for the opportunities that I have had in my life. I have been able to travel to many different places and to meet many interesting people. I have had the chance to learn new things and to experience new cultures. I believe that these experiences have made me a better person.

I am hopeful for the future. I believe that the world can be a better place. I am working towards making this a reality. I am also hopeful that I will continue to grow and learn new things. I believe that there is always room for improvement.

My favorite quote is "If life were predictable it would cease to be life

QApair.Question: How would you like your autobiography to be written?
QApair.Answer: I would like it to be written in a humorous way.

QApair.Question: What are some of the most important things you would like to include in your autobiography?
QApair.Answer: my embarrassing moments.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite thing about your life?
QApair.Answer: I lived care free.

QApair.Question: What are some of the challenges you have faced in your life?
QApair.Answer: Difficulty in studying.

QApair.Question: What are some of the things you are most proud of?
QApair.Answer: My accomplishments.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite memory?
QApair.Answer: going out on a vacation with parents.

QApair.Question: What is your worst memory?
QApair.Answer: getting bullied in school.

QApair.Question: What is your biggest fear?
QApair.Answer: people not accepting me.

QApair.Question: What is your biggest hope?
QApair.Answer: I will have a better future.

QApair.Question: What is your favorite quote?
QApair.Answer: "Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not." -Oscar Wilde

QApair.Question: What advice would you give to someone starting out in your field?
QApair.Answer: Do not give up.

QApair.Question: What would you like your epitaph to say?
QApair.Answer: "Bye World"

QApair.Question: Is there anything else you would like to include?
QApair.Answer: No, thank you.

Instances.Output:
I was born on a carefree day in the month of May. I don't recall much from my childhood, but I do remember getting bullied a lot in school. I was never the smartest kid in class, but I tried my best. I was always hoping for a better future. 

My biggest fear is people not accepting me. I worry that I'll never find my place in the world. But my biggest hope is that I'll find happiness and acceptance someday. 

I am most proud of my accomplishments. Despite all the challenges I've faced, I've managed to come out on top. I'm also proud of my ability to make people laugh. I see the humor in life, even when things are tough. 

One of my favorite memories is going on vacation with my parents. We went to the beach and had so much fun. I'll never forget the feeling of sand between my toes and the sound of waves crashing against the shore. 

My worst memory is getting bullied in school. I was always the odd one out and kids would make fun of me. It was a difficult time in my life, but I'm grateful for the lessons I learned. 

The advice I would give to someone starting out in my field is to never give up. It's not going to be easy, but it's worth it. If you keep pushing forward, eventually you'll reach your goal. 

I would like my epitaph to say "Bye World". It's a simple goodbye, but it's how I want to be remembered. I lived my life carefree and without regret.
